name: microfilm
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
film that is used for photographing information in a reduced size, or a piece of this film

to photograph information in a reduced size, using microfilm: The paper records were microfilmed to save storage space. The collection was microfilmed, so anyone who wanted to see it had to go to the library and look at it on microfilm.
More examplesFewer examplesOver time, the records were microfilmed and returned to the city archives.The amount of records is growing each year, and officials are microfilming some files to make room for more. The following year he began microfilming and scrutinising millions of documents.

(a length of) film containing photographed information in a reduced size
Add to word list
Add to word list
film on which photographs of documents are stored in a very small form, or a piece of this film: Most libraries have old newspapers available on microfilm.
to take a photograph of something using microfilm
